fact_list.fact_text: An AV is a vehicle that can drive from a starting location to a pre-determined destination using various technologies and sensors to sense its environment and navigate in autonomous mode.

As part of the long-term vision of deploying autonomous vehicles and shared-mobility concepts to complement Singapore's multi-modal land transport system, the Land Transport Authority (LTA) started facilitating AV trials in July 2015 at one-north.
The AV test-bed area was recently expanded to neighbouring areas such as the National University of Singapore, Singapore Science Park 1 and 2, Dover, and Buona Vista.
AVs that are approved by LTA for the purpose of trials on public roads are issued with permits and sport decals for easy recognition by road users.
A good driver is not merely one who is skilful in handling his/her vehicle competently but one who is safe.
A good driver must be patient, considerate, and courteous.
A good driver must have a sense of responsibility for the safety of other road users and the ability to concentrate, anticipate, and react appropriately while driving.
Safe driving calls for total awareness of what other road users are doing.
The correct attitude towards driving will make the road a safer and more pleasant place.
When you notice an AV being tested on the road, you should continue driving safely as you would normally do.
You are advised not to tailgate, as it is dangerous and an accident is inevitable if the front vehicle stops suddenly.
You should maintain a safe following distance by driving at a steady speed and avoiding unnecessary acceleration or braking.
Maintaining a safe distance between your vehicle and the AV allows you more time to react if necessary.
Overtaking should only be done if necessary and without endangering yourself or others.
When overtaking any vehicle, including AVs, ensure it is safe and leave a safe gap during the maneuver.
After overtaking, return to the appropriate lane as soon as it is safe to do so but avoid cutting in sharply in front of the overtaken vehicle.
